result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Slawski

records.addlTxt: No contact with Victim A listed in the criminal complaint

11:04 AM Defendant Andrew J Slawski in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Andrew J Slawski as friend of the court.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Wolff requests this matter be set for a preliminary hearing and waives time limits. 
Atty Wolff advises his client to contact the public defenders office to see if the appointment from 21CF198 be extended to this matter as well. 
Court sets matter for preliminary hearing.
Court addresses bail on this matter.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:03 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Andrew J Slawski appeared by Zoom phone. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. 

Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation. 
The Court will adjourn the initial appearance to the Trial Court so that the Defendant can appear in person and State can send out victim rights notification.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter requesting adjournment filed by Atty Wolff**Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 10/19 "Denied, he may appear via Zoom but due to victim notification the date will remain"
Motion and order to seal victim/witness identification Key
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
